  "description": "PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) Nigeria - Our client, a Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) registered infrastructure market holding company in Nigeria, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Risk and Quality Associate

Job Requisition ID: 683628WD
Job Locations:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description Summary


	Our Assurance Risk &amp; Quality team focuses on promoting and monitoring compliance with applicable external laws and regulations as well as internal policies and procedures to help manage PwC&#39;s regulatory, litigation, and reputational risk.
	To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level.
	As a Senior Associate, you&rsquo;ll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. The PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:&nbsp;
	Use feedback and reflection to develop self awareness, personal strengths and address development areas.
	Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities, coaching them to deliver results.
	Demonstrate critical thinking and the ability to bring order to unstructured problems.
	Use a broad range of tools and techniques to extract insights from current industry or sector trends.
	Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance.
	Know how and when to use tools available for a given situation and can explain the reasons for this choice.
	Seek and embrace opportunities which give exposure to different situations, environments and perspectives.
	Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing and connecting with others.
	Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality relationships.
	Uphold the firm&#39;s code of ethics and business conduct.


Primary Job Responsibilities / Accountabilities


	The Incumbent promotes adherence to PwC network and firm policies, professional standards and regulatory requirements.
	The Incumbent is responsible for the execution of risk, compliance and the system of quality management for the firm.
	Overview of activities


System of Quality Management (SoQM);


	Project manage the implementation of the firm s System of Quality Management (including coaching support to quality functions and process owners).
	Implement ongoing monitoring activities through related compliance testing and reporting of exceptions, action plans and conclusions.
	Support periodic compliance and quality reviews (regulatory or PwC network).
	&Acirc; Performs root cause analysis to identify and address audit quality issues.
	Facilitate and monitor implementation of remedial actions to prevent quality findings from recurring and help identify good practices as part of continuous improvement.
	Prepare required reports to assurance leadership, PwC network and regulators as necessary.


Compliance and Risk Management:


	Facilitate the understanding of and compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and professional standards;
	Facilitate, implement and monitor compliance with PwC network and local policies and procedures to manage risk, enhance quality control and comply with law, regulation and professional standards.
	Address practice inquiries on conflict of interest and independence matters as it relates to assurance services.
	&Acirc; In liaison with the internal counsel team, manage the firms contracting, client/engagement acceptance and continuance procedures


Educational Qualifications&nbsp;


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting / Finance / Business or related disciplines. Candidates must be ICAN, ACCA, CIA or equivalent qualified.
	Minimum years experience required
	Minimum of 3 years of relevant job experience in an external or internal audit role (preferably in a professional service firm).
	Hands on experience in designing, implementing and assessing a compliance function in a professional service firm;


Technical Competencies:


	Ambitious, mature and business-minded with strong leadership and high ethical standards
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, analytical ability and presentation skills
	Ability to manage diverse and multi locational teams, tight deadlines and prioritize tasks
	Willingness to travel as may be required in the role.

Risk and Quality Associate Job at PricewaterhouseCoopers




        
    

        
        PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) Nigeria - Our client, a Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) registered infrastructure market holding company in Nigeria, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Risk and Quality Associate

Job Requisition ID: 683628WD
Job Locations: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description Summary
     

            
    




	Our Assurance Risk & Quality team focuses on promoting and monitoring compliance with applicable external laws and regulations as well as internal policies and procedures to help manage PwC's regulatory, litigation, and reputational risk.
	To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level.
	As a Senior Associate, you’ll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. The PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to: 
	Use feedback and reflection to develop self awareness, personal strengths and address development areas.
	Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities, coaching them to deliver results.
	Demonstrate critical thinking and the ability to bring order to unstructured problems.
	Use a broad range of tools and techniques to extract insights from current industry or sector trends.
	Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance.
	Know how and when to use tools available for a given situation and can explain the reasons for this choice.
	Seek and embrace opportunities which give exposure to different situations, environments and perspectives.
	Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing and connecting with others.
	Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality relationships.
	Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.


Primary Job Responsibilities / Accountabilities


	The Incumbent promotes adherence to PwC network and firm policies, professional standards and regulatory requirements.
	The Incumbent is responsible for the execution of risk, compliance and the system of quality management for the firm.
	Overview of activities


System of Quality Management (SoQM);


	Project manage the implementation of the firm s System of Quality Management (including coaching support to quality functions and process owners).
	Implement ongoing monitoring activities through related compliance testing and reporting of exceptions, action plans and conclusions.
	Support periodic compliance and quality reviews (regulatory or PwC network).
	Â Performs root cause analysis to identify and address audit quality issues.
	Facilitate and monitor implementation of remedial actions to prevent quality findings from recurring and help identify good practices as part of continuous improvement.
	Prepare required reports to assurance leadership, PwC network and regulators as necessary.


Compliance and Risk Management:


	Facilitate the understanding of and compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and professional standards;
	Facilitate, implement and monitor compliance with PwC network and local policies and procedures to manage risk, enhance quality control and comply with law, regulation and professional standards.
	Address practice inquiries on conflict of interest and independence matters as it relates to assurance services.
	Â In liaison with the internal counsel team, manage the firms contracting, client/engagement acceptance and continuance procedures


Educational Qualifications 


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting / Finance / Business or related disciplines. Candidates must be ICAN, ACCA, CIA or equivalent qualified.
	Minimum years experience required
	Minimum of 3 years of relevant job experience in an external or internal audit role (preferably in a professional service firm).
	Hands on experience in designing, implementing and assessing a compliance function in a professional service firm;


Technical Competencies:


	Ambitious, mature and business-minded with strong leadership and high ethical standards
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, analytical ability and presentation skills
	Ability to manage diverse and multi locational teams, tight deadlines and prioritize tasks
	Willingness to travel as may be required in the role.

title: Job Vacancies at Teachly
content:
At Teachly, our mission is to transform the way the world learns by creating meaningful connections between passionate educators and eager students. We believe that every teacher has the power to make a lasting impact, and every student deserves access to personalized, high-quality instruction.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Tech Instructor

Job Location: Ibadan - Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a passionate and skilled Tech Instructor to join our educational team. The ideal candidate will teach and mentor students in Artificial Intelligence (AI), Web Development, and other emerging technologies.
	This role requires both strong technical expertise and the ability to simplify complex concepts into engaging, practical lessons for learners of varying skill levels.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and deliver hands-on lessons in AI concepts, machine learning basics, prompt engineering, and AI tool integration (ChatGPT, Sora, Runway, etc.).
	Teach full-stack Web Development — including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, and backend frameworks (PHP/Node.js/Next.js).
	Create project-driven curricula and guide students through real-world tech projects.
	Foster creativity and problem-solving through interactive assignments and AI-powered applications.
	Evaluate student progress, provide feedback, and maintain class engagement.
	Collaborate with other instructors and academic staff to improve course content and teaching quality.
	Stay updated with the latest trends in AI, web technologies, and digital education tools.
	Demonstrate practical use of AI in areas like web design, automation, content generation, and education.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience) with 1-3 years experience.
	Proven experience in web development (frontend and/or backend).
	Familiarity with AI concepts, tools, and frameworks (OpenAI tools, TensorFlow, ChatGPT, etc.).
	Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and at least one major framework (React, Next.js, or Vue).
	Excellent communication and presentation skills.
	Ability to work with students across different age groups and learning abilities.
	Passionate about technology, innovation, and education.


Salary
N75,000 - N100,000 per month.

Application Closing Date: 1st February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: teachlyhr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Marketing Executive

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a Sales & Marketing Officer who will actively drive customer acquisition and partnerships for Teachly.
	This role is ideal for a target-driven, people-oriented professional who enjoys engaging schools, institutions, students, and parents to convert interest into paying customers.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and approach partner schools, institutions, training centers, and students to promote Teachly’s services.
	Develop and execute marketing campaigns for school partnerships, training programs, workshops, and events.
	Support student enrollment and school onboarding through lead generation and follow-ups.
	Represent Teachly at school visits, outreach programs, exhibitions, and tech events.
	Conduct basic market research to identify new schools, communities, and partnership opportunities.
	Track marketing performance such as engagement, leads, and enrollment growth.
	Work closely with instructors, designers, the internal team,and management tomeet monthly sales and partnership targets
	Provide feedback from the field to help improve Teachly’s offerings and sales strategies.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Number of schools onboarded or engaged.
	Growth in student enrollment.


Ideal Candidate


	Believes in using technology to improve education.
	Comfortable working with schools, teachers, and parents.
	Energetic, proactive, and goal-driven.
	Able to combine creativity with measurable results.
	Existing network within the education sector in Ibadan or nearby cities.


Required Skills & Competencies
EdTech & Marketing Skills:


	Strong interpersonal, negotiation skills
	Community engagement and school outreach skills.


Soft Skill:


	Excellent communication and persuasion skills.
	Creativity and innovation.
	Strong organization and follow-up ability.
	Confidence in speaking with school owners, administrators, and parents.
	Willingness to learn and grow in EdTech marketing.


Salary
N75,000 - N100,000 per month.

Application Closing Date: 10th February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: teachlyhr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Full Stack Developer

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a skilled and motivated Full-Stack Developer to design, develop, and maintain scalable web applications across both front-end and back-end systems.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for building responsive user interfaces, developing secure server-side logic, integrating APIs, managing databases, and ensuring overall application performance and reliability.
	This role requires strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, develop, test, and deploy full-stack web applications.
	Build responsive and user-friendly front-end interfaces using modern frameworks.
	Develop and maintain server-side logic, APIs, and application services.
	Integrate third-party APIs and external services.
	Manage and optimize databases (SQL and NoSQL).
	Implement authentication, authorization, and security best practices.
	Troubleshoot, debug, and optimize application performance.
	Write clean, reusable, and well-documented code.
	Participate in code reviews and follow version control best practices.
	Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends.


Required Skills & Competencies
Front-End Skills:


	HTML, CSS, JavaScript
	React, Next.js, or similar frameworks
	Responsive design and UI/UX principles
	Tailwind CSS, Bootstrap, or CSS frameworks.


Back-End Skills:


	Node.js, Express.js, or similar backend frameworks
	RESTful APIs and/or GraphQL
	Authentication (JWT, OAuth)
	Server-side architecture and logic
	Flash Framework


Database & DevOps:


	SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL) and/or NoSQL (MongoDB)
	Version control (Git, GitHub/GitLab)
	Deployment platforms (Vercel, AWS, Azure, or similar)
	Basic CI/CD understanding


Soft Skills:


	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
	Good communication and teamwork abilities
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
	Attention to detail and code quality.


Application Closing Date: 10th February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: teachlyhr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
